Description: Bronze crescent-shaped axe-head: with three rear tangs each drilled with a binding-hole. The ends of the tangs are slightly curved. It was once thickly corroded but has now been completely cleaned. Corrosion has damaged the cutting edge and part of the central tang, and one of the lateral tangs is cracked.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (85)
